alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 2:50AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Tammany, southeastern Tangipahoa and south central Washington Parishes, southern Hancock and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 250 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Folsom to near Waveland. Movement was southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Picayune, Covington, Waveland, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Abita Springs, Madisonville, Folsom, Sun, Kiln, Pearlington, Lacombe, Shoreline Park, Stennis Space Center, Bush and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 261 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 17. Interstate 12 between mile markers 52 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany; Washington
